summary: A beautiful and breathtaking 7-day road-trip through ENB county. - Albert Einstein
descriptionHtml:
[b]I. Simplicity ENB by Raigen[/b]

Welcome to the sweet home of my ENB preset, just one of the aprox. five billion out there.
[color=#999999][size=1][i]"Hidden deep inside its data core is paradise, or a 7-day Mcafee Antivirus trial." - Abraham Lincoln[/i][/size][/color]

[b]II. Required Files[/b]

[url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.html][color=#e06666]The latest ENB binary for Skyrim. (0.262+)[/color][/url]

[b]III. Recommended Files[/b]
[color=#999999][i]
These mods have a strong visual impact and are recommended for use in combination with my ENB preset.[/i][/color]
[color=#999999][i]All listed mods below were used in combination with my preset.[/i][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50065/?][color=#ffd966]Natural Lighting and Atmospherics for ENB (only use the .esp file)[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30450/?][color=#ffd966]Realistic Lighting Overhaul (activate everything aside the weather plugins)[/color][/url]

[b]IV. Optional Files[/b]

[color=#999999][i]These mods are not neccessary to have but add to the overall visual fidelity of the game.[/i][/color]
[color=#999999][i]All listed mods below were either used or tested in combination with my preset.[/i][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8655/?][color=#93c47d]Static Mesh Improvement Mod - SMIM[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38539/?][color=#93c47d]Skyrim Realistic Texture Overhaul[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42370/?][color=#93c47d]Unique Grasses and Groundcovers - Nature and Landscape Enhancement[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1111/?][color=#93c47d]Pure Waters[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40564/?][color=#93c47d]SkyFalls and SkyMills - Animated Distant Waterfalls and WindMills[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/836/?][color=#93c47d]Realistic Smoke and Embers[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57514/?][color=#93c47d]EWIs improved vanilla thickets 1k[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44201/?][color=#93c47d]Dust Effects[/color][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/810/?][color=#93c47d]HQ Milky way galaxy[/color][/url]

[b]V. Installation, Setup[/b]

Should you be completely new to the whole ENB shebang, don't worry, the internet got you covered.

[url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:ENB#tab=Quickstart][color=#6d9eeb]S.T.E.P guide to ENB[/color][/url]

Following the steps on that page should get you ready in no time!

Once all files are in place, extract my preset's files and use them to replace your old ones.

[b]VI. Configuration, Tweaks[/b]

From the get go, the effects enabled are the following:

[b][color=#999999]Bloom
Adaptation
Detailed Shadows
Sun Rays
Sun Glare
Sky Lighting
Subsurface Scattering
Cloud Shadows
Mist[/color][/b]

Most additional effects like [b]SSAO[/b], [b]Water[/b], [b]Underwater[/b], [b]Depth of Field[/b] etc... are already pre-configured and can be enabled at will.

If you would like to gain some more performance, I recommend to keep [b]Bloom[/b], [b]Adaptation[/b] and [b]Detailed Shadows[/b] enabled,
the rest can be disabled if needed.

Post processing effects such as [b]Exposure[/b], [b]Gamma[/b], [b]Saturation[/b] or [b]Depth of Field[/b] can be altered through the in-game ENB menu.
The default shortcut to open it is [b]Shift[/b] + [b]Enter[/b].

Depending on your setup, you might want to play around with the [b]Exposure[/b] and [b]Gamma[/b] values.
Every monitor is different (duh) and I can't possibly foresee how the game might look for you. (My 8-ball aint helping).

[b]VII. What is love, baby dont hurt me, dont hurt me, no more.[/b]

Congratulations, you did it! You beat the tutorial! *fanfares*

I want to thank my producer, my manager and my family.

[b]VIII. Credits[/b]

Boris Vorontsov (creator of the ENB mod series).
Other specific code-related credits are found in the correlating files.
author: Raigen
